divs: Sighting Details I was taking my dog for a walk in the yard and I saw two bright objects in the sky....say if north was 12 on the clock, and south was 6 (30), they were at approx.the 28, or just about half way between the 5 and 6. At first when I saw them, I thought Venus or whatever, but never heard of another thing as bright shining in the sky, so I kept my focus on them. They could have been there or thereabouts much longer, but from the time I saw them....it lasted about 15-20 seconds of them staying still til one of them just taking off at a speed I never thought possible (up and to the south) as an example, it went from a pea sized bright light to a grain of fine sand in less than a second. The other one stayed for a second longer and then flew off in the same manner. There were no storms in the area, it was a clear sky......no explanation that I can think of??
Summary: Saw two bright objects close to each other in the southern sky. One flew away at an astronomical speed, the other stayed a sec. longer and proceeded the same way.
trends: There has been one other sighting in Greenville
There were no other sightings in Greenville on or around May 30th 2009
